Talon:

Talon embraced him back


From: Sandy 
Sent: Tuesday, April 06, 201=
0 10:57 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Un=
icron's come back


  
Tucson embraces her.

"I'd never do anything to hurt=
 you and if you don't wish to do that I'm all right with it. I'll just have=
 to fudge it somehow."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrot=
e:
>
> Talon:
> Talon shook in fear "Dont tell him that I'm here... dont do=
 it... i can set Lord Perseus in danger... i owe him too much... I cant pay=
 him in this way... Please dont ask me to do it"
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sen=
t: Tuesday, April 06, 2010 10:28 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject=
: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Unicron's come back
> 
> 
> 
> OOC: I wrote a po=
st, but I dont' know if it went through, if it does come through, just dele=
te the most recent one if it does.
> 
> BIC:
> 
> Tucson smiles and continu=
es to hold Talon's hand. It was what he hoped to hear. Deep down he was hop=
ing that somewhere along the line someone like Nightstrike could turn over =
a new leaf. She was proof of it.
> 
> " Talon, I'm actually happy you told =
me this. It actually assures me that my intentions aren't as crazy as I tho=
ught they may seem. Remember when we were fighting Nightstrike? How skilled=
 he appeared to be? He gave us a run for our money, mainly me, but there wa=
s sheer talent in his approach, sheer talent that would not have been at al=
l recognized if I hadn't encountered him. I don't think Unicron would have =
ever appreciated him for that, instead, he uses him as a puppet to do his d=
irty work, not at all giving him recognition for his efforts. And what does=
 he do when they fail? Disposes of them. But what if someone else, who he t=
hought was an enemy, actually turned out to be a friend? You've proven that=
 it can happen, see? It doesn't change how I feel about you. So, this time,=
 I'd like to try a different approach with Nightstrike. I'd like you to be =
with me as well as Depthcharge and the others, because I want them to see t=
he same thing. If we show compassion to those who are otherwise cast asside=
, because they aren't good enough, we can make friends out of enemies. Okay=
, let's go see if this works. It might not."
> 
> He escorts Talon outside,=
 holding her hand.
> 
> "Okay guys, sorry about that.. I had a slow leak in=
 two tires and I had a heck of a time finding spares."
> 
> Rat Trap nodds.=

> 
> "Thought so. Kinda is hard ta find tires for a big guy like you." 
> =

> Tucson now looks to the others as he also transmits to Lord Elder.
> 
> =
" First, I'm also transmitting to Lord Elder and Kup, and guys, sorry about=
 earlier, I didn't mean to scare you. Okay, everyone, this is what I hope t=
o accomplish.. Nightstrike may be a minion, but Unicron doesn't value his m=
inions like we value each other. I doubt he's ever been shown appreciation =
for his talents and abilities. And I have a feeling he's been given false p=
romises. I'd like to try and talk to him, on a neutral basis, because even =
though he doesn't work for Hydras, he may just have some understanding abou=
t Predacon technology that may come in handy if Night Shift isn't able to g=
et the information on his end, due to the level of risk he's taking. I don'=
t want him to go over his head on something. If he needs to abandon the mis=
sion, please, inform him that I have nothing against it. In fact, I hope he=
 realizes when it does become too dangerous to pull out. So this way, if he=
 can't get it, at least I might have a chance to get it on my end. I'm begi=
ning to think that maybe I may have to resort to plan B after all."
> 
> Ra=
t Trap swallows.
> 
> " So, Night Shift might not make it?"
> 
> Tucson sha=
kes his head.
> 
> "I highly doubt it. It was a very risky proposition and =
I don't know why I even let him do it."
> 
> Rat Trap salutes Tucson Prime.=

> 
> " Tucson Prime, I hereby volunteer my little rat aft ta a call of dan=
gerous rescue duty. If I got ya outa there before I can do it for Night Shi=
ft."
> 
> Tucson looks to him.
> 
> "I can't ask you to do that Rat Trap. Y=
ou almost lost your life back there, I can't have that hang over my head, a=
bsolutely not. We'll see how it plays out. He may be able to get out of the=
re, but if he puts in a distress call, I'll assemble a rescue team for the =
job. All right, let's do this. Lord Elder, Kup, I will inform you of my sta=
tus after I've conversed with Nightstrike. Tucson Prime out."
> 
> --- In n=
bwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@> wrote:
> >
> > Talon::
> > 
> > Talon s=
miled and added while her smile turned a bittter one"Then the true must be =
told, cause you deserve it and I love you... My true name isnt Talon... it =
was Blacknightmare I was once together mi sister, a Minion... A servant of =
Unicron... Lord Perseus and Kenzo is awared of my true identity, and they p=
rovided me a sactuary and a new life; Now Tucson,do you still love me or do=
 you hate me with all your heart? do you want to know how I finish in Maxim=
al Side?"
> > 
> > 
> > From: Sandy 
> > Sent: Monday, April 05, 2010 9:43 =
PM
> > To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> > Subject: Re: The Old Maximal Base/Un=
icron's come back
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > Tucson quickly realizes that his com l=
ink was still engaged. He gets a slight startled, but with a very sheepish =
grin on his face, he tries to answer Lord Elder the best he can.
> > 
> > "=
Oh, Lord Elder, Kup, sorry about that.. I'm fine, nothing's wrong.. Nothing=
 - at all.. I - I.. Um, well, I - just got a very strong batch of Energon a=
nd it kind of threw me off guard.. Caused all sorts of power surges but I a=
ssure you I'm no worse for ware. I - was just on my way to Nightstrike when=
 I ran a little low on fuel, so I was given something here and it had a few=
 side effects... Look, I'm a little tied up right now, I'll definitely get =
back to you when I have more time. Tucson Prime out."
> > 
> > This time he=
 manages to disengage the com link.
> > 
> > "Ohh boy, I sure hope he bough=
t that one. It's not like me to lie but some things are best kept to oursel=
ves. And this time, I remember where I left off."
> > 
> > He had not reali=
zed it but Tucson was capable of many emotions, love being one of them.
> >=
 
> > Outside the storage area, Rat Trap tries to cover for Tucson and look=
s over to the area while scratching behind his head.
> > 
> > "Hmm, Wheels =
went inta the storage bay. He could've had ta replace a tire or two and is =
havn' a hard time lookn' for tires that fit his specs. Isn't too easy findn=
' wheels for that big guy I bet." 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, =
Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Who: Lord Elder
> > > L=
ocation: The Ark's command center
> > > 
> > > Lord Elder looked over curio=
usly at Kup as Tuscon completed his
> > > communcation, his face somewhat c=
onfused and worried. "Was it is just
> > > me or did Tuscon sound a bit flu=
stered?"
> > > 
> > > Elder does a quick sensor reading, and after a few mo=
ments the sensors
> > > track Tuscon's last radio communication as comming =
from the area in or
> > > around the old Maximal base.
> > > 
> > > It was =
only then that Lord Elder heard the screeching of tires over
> > > the com =
signal that suddenly cut out.
> > > 
> > > "Lord Perseus, Tuscon, do you re=
quire assistance there?" Lord Elder
> > > said, obviously misreading the wh=
ole situation.
> > > 
> > > (TAG)
> > > 
> > > Preston
> > >
> >
>
